getByPath

public static java.lang.Object getByPath(org.w3c.dom.Element releaseElem,
                                         java.lang.String path)
Get node value by path name, in limited xpath format. For example
  • getByPath(curr,"@attr"); - gets attribute attr value from given node
  • getByPath(curr,"/some/elem"); - gets element value for elem element within some element off root
    • < li>getByPath(curr,"/some/@attr"); - gets attribute value for attr attribute of some element
  • getByPath(curr,"some"); - gets attribute value for some element
// and other xpath operators are not supported.

Parameters:
releaseElem -
path -
Returns:
object at path, a string, or node of some sort

getChildElements

public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> getChildElements(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                                   java.lang.String childElemName)
Get immediate child elements with the given name (whereas getElementsByTagName will get any named elems, not just immediate children)

Parameters:
element -
childElemName -
Returns:
elements with given name
